title: One More Time by Daft Punk
content:
I was wondering if anyone has or can make a full version of the font used by Daft Punk in their One More Time single cover. The font is called "WatchMNOutline\_," but all the version I have found don't have lowercase letters. If anyone can make the uppercase letters the lowercase ones as well, it would be perfect. Also, here are some covers for reference-

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031234002im_/http:/typophile.com/files/OneMoreTime_4000.jpg)

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031234002im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Daft+Punk+-+One+More+Time+-+One+More+Virgin+-+DOUBLE+CD-203300_6470.jpg)
author: cybercat5555

comments.content: The last image didn't work. Here is a direct link- [http://eil.com/images/main/Daft+Punk+-+One+More+Time+-+One+More+Virgin+-...](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031234002/http:/eil.com/images/main/Daft+Punk+-+One+More+Time+-+One+More+Virgin+-+DOUBLE+CD-203300.jpg "http://eil.com/images/main/Daft+Punk+-+One+More+Time+-+One+More+Virgin+-+DOUBLE+CD-203300.jpg")
LED displays (what the font is based off of) rarely have lowercase letterforms.
I know, but I am just asking if anyone can just copy and paste the uppercase letters to the empty lowercase ones, to make a "complete" font

Darrel, you might enjoy this:  
 [http://www.flickr.com/photos/48413419@N00/5131387585/](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031234002/http:/www.flickr.com/photos/48413419@N00/5131387585/ "http://www.flickr.com/photos/48413419@N00/5131387585/")

hhp

I like this font pretty much. I know that there are a lot of people who doesn't like this.  
 [microsoft error codes](http://web.archive.org/web/20141031234002/http:/www.microsoftproblems.com/microsoft-help/fixing-microsoft-activex-control/)  
I admit that this font is a bit old fashioned, with the rainbow colour, but it has still got a stylish look.

This is a commercial font, from Mecanorma. Their current standard license is quite explicit about disallowing any such modifications:

"Licensee may not modify, make error corrections" ... "add or subtract any glyphs, symbols or accents, or any other derivative works based on the electronic font software in this product in whole or in part, whatsoever."

The license section in question is a seven-line sentence fragment. I imagine it would still hold up in court, and the intent is clear enough, but grammatically it is horrendous.

Anyway, so the right thing to do would be to contact the foundry.

+1 (610) 584-7233  
 [support@houseoftype.com](mailto:support@houseoftype.com)
